titleInfo.title: (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 1/26/09 ORDERING that pltf's 2 request to proceed ifp is GRANTED; pltf to pay the $350 filing fee in accordance w/ the CDC order; pltf's claims against all dfts but for Hawkins, Smith, Nale, Williams, Rad, Chin, Pappoe and Don are DISMISSED w/ leave to file an ameneded cmplt w/in 30 days; upon filing an amended cmplt or expiration of the time allowed therefor, the court will make further orders for service upon some or all of the dfts. (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 11/17/09 denying 31 Motion to Stay; denying 37 Motion for Extension of time. Plaintiff is granted 28 days from the date of this order to file any additional motions to compel against defendants Chin, Pappoe, Stevenson, Burl and Don. Plaintiff is granted 28 days from the date of this order to serve defendant Rad with additional discovery requests. Defendant Rad's responses to any discovery requests are due 21 days thereafter. Any motions to compel are due within 84 days from the date of this order. No requests for extension of time regarding discovery will be granted to either party. The dispositive motion filing date of 01/15/10 is vacated and reset for 04/30/10. (Plummer, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:08-cv-03069; (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 11/17/09 denying 31 Motion to Stay; denying 37 Motion for Extension of time. Plaintiff is granted 28 days from the date of this order to file any additional motions to compel against defendants Chin, Pappoe, Stevenson, Burl and Don. Plaintiff is granted 28 days from the date of this order to serve defendant Rad with additional discovery requests. Defendant Rad's responses to any discovery requests are due 21 days thereafter. Any motions to compel are due within 84 days from the date of this order. No requests for extension of time regarding discovery will be granted to either party. The dispositive motion filing date of 01/15/10 is vacated and reset for 04/30/10. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al

(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 8/10/10, ORDERING that the Clerk shall serve this order upon Carter Capps White, King Hall Civil Rights Clinic, UC Davis School of Law. The King Hall Civil Rights Clinic should inform the court within 30 days of the issuance of this order as to whether it will accept limited representation of pltf. Upon notice from the King Hall Civil Rights Clinic, the court will set a briefing schedule for the issue described in the order. (Kastilahn, A)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 1/11/11, ORDERING that counsel for dfts Rad, Chin, Pappoe, Stevenson, and Don SHALL provide pltf's counsel all discovery NO LATER than 30 days from the issuance of this Order. Pltf SHALL file a motion on whether the denial of pltf's request for an expert witness offends his constitutional rights NO LATER than 60 days thereafter. Dfts SHALL respond to the motion NO LATER than 30 days thereafter. Pltf MAY file a reply 20 days thereafter. The motion SHALL be heard on June 20, 2011 at 10:00 a.m.(Kastilahn, A)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:08-cv-03069; (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al;

titleInfo.title: (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER TO BE PUBLISHED signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 6/29/11, ORDERING that the court finds that 69 the Magistrate Judge's order denying plaintiff's request for appointment of an expert witness under Rule 706 was clearly erroneous. Plaintiff shall submit an ex parte request to incur costs and request for payment of expert witness fees pursuant to General Order No. 230 within 60 days of the issuance of this order. Plaintiff may file the request under seal. The court no longer refers this case to the Magistrate Judge. All future non-discovery motions shall be filed before this court. All previously scheduled dates are VACATED, and a Scheduling Conference is hereby SET for 9/19/2011 at 02:00 PM in Courtroom 4 (LKK) before Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton. The parties shall file status reports 14 days prior to the conference. (Kastilahn, A)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:08-cv-03069; (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER TO BE PUBLISHED signed by Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 6/29/11, ORDERING that the court finds that 69 the Magistrate Judge's order denying plaintiff's request for appointment of an expert witness under Rule 706 was clearly erroneous. Plaintiff shall submit an ex parte request to incur costs and request for payment of expert witness fees pursuant to General Order No. 230 within 60 days of the issuance of this order. Plaintiff may file the request under seal. The court no longer refers this case to the Magistrate Judge. All future non-discovery motions shall be filed before this court. All previously scheduled dates are VACATED, and a Scheduling Conference is hereby SET for 9/19/2011 at 02:00 PM in Courtroom 4 (LKK) before Senior Judge Lawrence K. Karlton. The parties shall file status reports 14 days prior to the conference. (Kastilahn, A)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Gorton v. Todd et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and WRIT of HABEAS CORPUS AD TESTIFICANDUM ISSUED signed by Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 1/03/13. Ordering the Custodian of California Institution for Men to temporarily transfer Charles Robert Gorton to Mule Creek State Prison. The Warden of Mule Creek State Prison subsequently shall produce Charles Robert Gorton at 2/20/13 at 10:30 a.m. in courtroom 4 before Judge Lawrence K. Karlton. Custodian is ordered to notify the court of any changes in custody and to provide new custodian with a copy of this writ. Clerk shall serve a copy of this order and writ on the custodian and Out-to-Court Desk. (cc: OTCD)(3 certified copies sent to the Warden at California Institution for Men and 3 certified copies sent to the Warden of Mule Creek State Prison)(Plummer, M) Modified on 1/4/2013 (Plummer, M). Modified on 1/4/2013 (Plummer, M).

extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Judge Lawrence K. Karlton on 4/12/13 ORDERING that the court exercises its discretion to decline to tax costs in favor of Defendants in this case. (Kastilahn, A)
